text:
63F who presented to OSH ED with flu like symptoms, fever, and SOB. Her
   symptoms began Friday [**11-16**] with body aches and a cough. She also
   reports an H1N1 outbreak in her area, developed fever to 102 and chills
   last night, and today developed wheezing. Cough was dry,
   non-productive, Symptoms associated with generalized fatigue and
   weakness and lightheadedness especially on standing. She had nausea but
   no vomiting, and did have diarrhea x 3 today. She presented to an OSH
   ED, where she was noted to be hypoxic to 85% RA, and hypotensive to
   80s. CXR showed bilat infiltrates.  Received 2l IVF CTX, azithro, and
   transferred to [**Hospital1 19**].
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 11**])
   Assessment:
   New admission from ED,confirmed H1N1 from OSH
   Afebrile HR 100
s,RR 35-40,unable to lie flat,sats 92-95% on NC 5L
   Systolic pressure 100-120 admitted with  levophed  0.04 mic
   Action:
     Team notified about  tachypnea, NRBM  changed to NC  5L
   NS 1L bolus blood culture
   On triple antibiotics, awaiting for ID approval for tamiflu
   Response:
   CVP  4 ,levo turned off,NBP stable
   Pt  reports that she is comfortable with her breathing initially after
   admission but by 0600 c/o more SOB,
I cant relax
, informed MD,team  at
   bedside to evaluate.NC changed to NRBM .
   Plan:
   Monitor resp status,on droplet precaution.
   Supplemental o2 as needed
   Possible intubation  for worsening resp status
